text: No, for that you have to create a public app.
That indeed made it. Thanks so much <@U039AQS6SM6> :bow:
Hi guys,as a developer, I would like to know which IPs are bound to this domain（<https://api.hubapi.com>）. Our company needs to do firewall configuration.Thanks in advance
Hi, can someone give me an input on how to get all the companies associated to a contact.

Alternatively you can use the associations API, though you will only get a list of company record id’s (rather than information about the company, so using the search API generally saves having to do multiple API calls)

Hi all! :wave: I'm new to HubSpot and needing to export all of the blog posts from my current site to import them to a new non-HubSpot site. However the regular export tool doesn't process the content of my blog posts. I'm able to export everything else but the content itself. That happened because the module is custom, so the data is unstructured and according to the support team - HubSpot's system doesn't have knowledge of what it considers a post_body in that module. The only solution is to use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/blog-post|Get all blog posts endpoint> and parse through all of the widgets (i.e. modules) in the response to pull the info from the custom Blog Post module. There are a ton of widgets and other parts of content in the JSON I get from that endpoint and I see no pattern at all to work with and unify.
Does anyone have any experience or ideas on how to approach that?

Thanks a lot in advance!
Hey all! Has anyone managed to create emails via API and get the "hs_email_headers" property to parse out into from/to/etc?
Hi Great Developers of HubSpot I have a missing token in my Wordpress HubSpot plugin anybody can help ?
I have this problem in a month
really need help badly

hey friends!  after a LOT of digging, we found out where the issue was and a patch is being deployed soon and we should be good to go :+1:.  Thanks for calling this out and the patience :slightly_smiling_face:
:dennisisawesome:
<@UQNEXHW14> can we get that emoji?
Hello everyone, is there an api to add related companies?
when you say related companies, you mean company to company associations, right?
Hello, My Data I'm importing /creating is not communicating with my webhook inside the app I made with my developer account. Can someone help?
Yes

sorry, no.. inter object is not supported yet, but INTRA is.. I know HubSpot is CURRENTLY working on more diverse associations including contact to contact and company to company. and even assign this in a workflow.
Beta is expected soon.
Perfect, thanks for the help
you are correct on the interface side, this is manually possible
hello
not through the api?
nope the company API is limited... you could however (if you have an enterprise license create a custom object for the parent, and associate the companies to it.. the API works there
I understand, thanks
Did you add event subscriptions under Manage Apps > Your App > Webhooks > Event subscriptions?
Also be sure the event is “Active”

Hi everyone! I am wondering if anyone knows how to create a task that is assigned to a specific queue, and associated to  a custom object? In the <https://api.hubapi.com/engagements/v1/engagements> api, I am able to assign to a specific queue, but I can't figure out how to associate to a custom object, and for this API <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/tasks>, I can't figure out how to assign to a queue. Thanks for the help!
Yes I did them. I clicked test and the test data comes through fine. It’s just no linked with my database. From my non developer account when i create a contact it doesn’t trigger any payload
<@U038DUUV3GE> sorry I didn’t give you more context.
Hey <@U039AQS6SM6> ,  I'll try here. Thanks!
did you install the app in your HubSpot account?
It should show up in Settings > Integrations > Connected Apps
It doens't show up on Connected Apps, I'm not sure what to do. I added my url here
Copy the full URL then go to it and authorize the app with your HubSpot account (if you are a part of multiple HubSpot accounts it will ask you to choose which account you want to install the app on)
I added that and copied full url then chose the main account (that holds the database)
It still doesn't show up on my "connected apps"
I think I will have to buy you coffee for this much help...
Is your heroku app configured to handle the oauth redirect
I would read this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/working-with-oauth>
There are code examples for the above flow located here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth-quickstart-guide>
Thank you!
Thank you very much. I will try and read the documentation start from creating the install button with html.

Once you send the code from the redirect url back to the HubSpot api with the client id and client secret, the app should show as connected and should trigger the webhooks that are configured in your app
Good luck!
Hi All how do i identify localizable fields in HUBspot over the API. Is there a easy way to figure this out?
Thanks <@U3T21PDBK>

I wasn't sure what you meant by "send the code from the redirect url back to the HubSpot api with the client id and client secret, the app should show as connected and should trigger the webhooks that are configured in your app"
Never mind I think I realize now I have to make a url path for call_api inside my app with the parameters of the generated code from the back of the redirect url.

Hey everyone!

Is there any info on upserting to the HubSpot custom object API? I see endpoints for:

• updating: `POST */crm/v3/objects/{objectType}/batch/update*`
• creating: `POST */crm/v3/objects/{objectType}/batch/create*`
If I have a payload that is a mix of new and potentially existing objects, do I have to separate them? Or will the api know to upsert them accordingly?
